This book was one of my favorites, but I am definitely not going to be jumping out of my seat like I thought I would be in order to see this movie.

author: Caffeine Red Squirrel

text: At the moment I am extremely upset because I have been looking forward to the book to movie adaptation of my favorite book ,however, after seeing the teaser trailer I'm just really mad. I can already see that they have stripped out all the good incredible life lessons and taken away the main story line leaving nothing but a cliché highschool movie. Sure it will be an okay movie on its own, it will probably do really well, but why can't anyone just leave things be the way they are? The main reason that I fell in love with this book was because, not only did it change the way I looked at a lot of things and give me confidence, but it also had an amazing story line with excellent character development and a very realistic aspect to it. And from what I've seen of this trailer I can tell that I'm not going to have anything near what I expected. I'm just really frustrated and disappointed right now. I just need to rant so.... I'm just done.

text: The first thing I thought after watching this trailer: They HAVE to Change the name of this movie! Because when it is not associated with this books it might be a funny (stereotypical) Comedy, but not one scene of this trailer had anything to do with the book! The book wasn't a Comedy, it had some serious topics in it and a really good message about the whole DUFF thing. And Wesley wasn't a typical cocky Jock in the book! What I really liked abouthimt was that even though he acted like a  jerk he wasn't ashamed for any of his decisions and for beeing with Bianca. And there WASN'T A MEAN GIRL IN THE BOOK! At least not in the way it was depicted in this trailer... Very sad...
author: Papaya Queen

text: okay I know I know, there are a LOT of comments like this but I just have to. Some of this seems funny but this is not made after the book I have read more then six times. No. Just, that book is perfect, amazing. Why did they changed the plot completly? Bianica didn't wanna change, so why? This just has nothing to do with the book. Maybe it will be a good movie but I just feel really sad. Book is about how everybody is a duff, not about duff becoming whoever the hell this girl ( that is NOT Bianica) becomes. Okay no. They had an deep connection, and when you ask a guy to give you an makeover? Well sorry but that connection is deep as potty. Aloso B would never ask him to give her an makeover. This is not her. This may or may not be an good movie but it wasn't made after the book. Okay sorry, I just had to write this down. It's just that they could've make an GREAT movie, but they made this. This might me an good comedy, but the book was more then comedy. It had serious topics and I don't even know. Also please don't hate me or my grammar, english is not my first language.

text: I adore this book. It's a mature read for teens, with a lot of personal growth. The relationship between Bianca and Wesley was mostly friends with benefits, for the majority of the book. He never gave her a makeover and the book wasn't ANYTHING like this trailer makes it look like. I'm hoping this is the case where the trailer is way different from the actual movie, but if not, I'll be super disappointed. What I loved about DUFF was that while it seemed really surface level, it wasn't. It was a lot deeper than I expected. This movie looks like they kept the phrase "DUFF," but trashed the actual emotional parts and turned it into a crappy teen movie.
author: Madison

text: Really disappointed in this film already--nothing resembles the basic plot of the book besides the use of the word Duff....I mean, it's TOTALLY different. You expect a little creative license when film adaptations are made but this is really and truly nothing like the book. There is no 'Ugly Duckling gets madeover' plot. This isn't what the books is about, in fact, it's the opposite. This truly is a fail.

What a toxic thing to put in the minds of adolescent girls. This really upset me.

text: Let me break it down for y'all (this is based off of posts I've seen on Tumblr, okay? Forgive me if I'm wrong, I haven't seen the film):  The DUFF was supposed to teach young adults to appreciate themselves and their bodies, despite being "ugly" or "fat." The acronym was just to put in as a lesson to teach you that IT'S OKAY IF YOU DON'T FIT IN WITH YOUR GROUP OF FRIENDS. Don't bash on the movie just because it seems to be fat-shaming anyone or anything. And although the girl DOES get the guy, it still teaches you to love yourself. This is no Fifty Shades or American Sniper. It does you no harm.

text: Noooo. This is literally nothing like the book wtf? It looks cool but i read the book for nothing? What happened to the nest and Bianca and Wesley doing it all the time? I finished the book yesterday i read it in two days and it wasnt about a girl who needed a boys approval and changes herself to not be the duff. It was about a girl excepting herself and not caring abouy what others thought of her. And about a boy who learns to be more human and opens up to his problems and becoming a little bit less of a womanizer. Dont get me wrong the movie looks good but not anywhere close to as good as the book. Im honestly disappointed.😕
